name: UpdateOnCallEscalationPolicy
description:
Update an On-Call escalation policy in Datadog.

This tool allows updating an existing On-Call escalation policy in Datadog. Use it to modify the details of a specific policy by providing the necessary updates.

parameters.name: escalation_policy_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the escalation policy to be updated.

value_schema.description: The ID of the escalation policy

parameters.name: escalation_policy_update_data
parameters.description: JSON object containing the updated attributes, ID, relationships, and type for the escalation policy.

name.description: Specifies the name of the escalation policy.

resolve_page_on_policy_end.description: Indicates whether the page is automatically resolved when the policy ends.

retries.description: Specifies how many times the escalation sequence is retried if there is no response.

assignment.description: Specifies how this escalation step will assign targets (example `default` or `round-robin`).

escalate_after_seconds.description: Defines how many seconds to wait before escalating to the next step.

id.description: Specifies the unique identifier of this step.
Specifies the unique identifier for this target.

type.description: Specifies the type of escalation target (example `users`, `schedules`, or `teams`).

targets.description: Specifies the collection of escalation targets for this step.

steps.description: A list of escalation steps, each defining assignment, escalation timeout, and targets.

attributes.description: Defines the attributes that can be updated for an escalation policy, such as description, name, resolution behavior, retries, and steps.

id.description: Specifies the unique identifier of the escalation policy being updated.
The unique identifier of the team in this relationship.

data.description: An array of team references for this schedule.

teams.description: Associates teams with this schedule in a data structure.

relationships.description: Represents relationships in an escalation policy update request, including references to teams.

type.description: Indicates that the resource is of type `policies`.

data.description: Represents the data for updating an existing escalation policy, including its ID, attributes, relationships, and resource type.
